snippet: A lawyer for a Guantánamo Bay detainee called the force-feeding procedures “gratuitous suffering,” while the Justice Department said the measures were intended to keep prisoners healthy.
abstract: Testimony begins in trial of Guantanamo Bay detainee Jihad Ahmed Mujstafa Diyab, Syrian who is challenging the military's procedures for force-feeding prisoners who are on hunger strike; force-feeding procedure involves strapping a detainee into a restraint chair and inserting a tube though his nose, though which a liquid dietary supplement is poured.
lead_paragraph: A lawyer for a Guantánamo Bay detainee called the force-feeding procedures “gratuitous suffering,” while the Justice Department said the measures were intended to keep prisoners healthy.

headline.main: A Practice Goes on Trial: Force-Feeding a Detainee
headline.print_headline: A Practice Goes on Trial: Force-Feeding a Detainee

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
